Let
$$r_n = x - \sum_{k=1}^{n} {\left\langlex,e_k\right\rangle}\cdot e_k.$$
Then for $j=1,\ldots,n$, $$\begin{aligned}
{\left\langler_n,e_j\right\rangle} &=
{\left\langlex,e_j\right\rangle} -
\sum_{k=1}^{n} {\left\langle{\left\langlex,e_k\right\rangle}\cdot e_k,e_j\right\rangle} \\
&= {\left\langlex,e_j\right\rangle} -
{\left\langlex,e_j\right\rangle}{\left\langlee_j,e_j\right\rangle} = 0\end{aligned}$$
so $e_1,\ldots,e_n,r_n$ is an orthogonal series.

Computing norms, we see that
$${\left\|x\right\|}^2 = {\left\|r_n + \sum_{k=1}^{n} {\left\langlex,e_k\right\rangle}\cdot e_k\right\|}^2 =
{\left\|r_n\right\|}^2 + \sum_{k=1}^{n} {\left|{\left\langlex,e_k\right\rangle}\right|}^2 \ge
\sum_{k=1}^{n} {\left|{\left\langlex,e_k\right\rangle}\right|}^2.$$ So
the series
$$\sum_{k=1}^{\infty} {\left|{\left\langlex,e_k\right\rangle}\right|}^2$$
converges and is bounded by ${\left\|x\right\|}^2$, as required.
